snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative bloc and the Social Democrats to open formal negotiations next week on reviving the “grand coalition” after a breakthrough on the issue of minimum wage.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative bloc and its Social Democratic rivals agree to open formal negotiations on reviving 'grand coalition' that led Germany from 2005 to 2009; both sides suggest coalition could steer biggest European economy into four more prosperous years.
lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative bloc and the Social Democrats to open formal negotiations next week on reviving the “grand coalition” after a breakthrough on the issue of minimum wage.

headline.main: German Parties to Begin Talks to Revive Coalition
headline.print_headline: German Parties to Begin Talks to Revive Coalition
